item.title: 股票需求飙升，香港银行动用2019年以来最多资金
item.description: 本周二，香港银行借入了五年多来最大一笔短期现金，以满足对本地股票的旺盛需求。【原文：Hong Kong banks borrowed the largest amount of short-term cash in more than five years on Tuesday, as they sought to keep up with a booming demand for local equities.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁加征汽车关税，日本向美国提出汽车关税问题
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁要对汽车进口征收 25% 的关税后，日本向美国提出了汽车关税问题，此举很可能会对日本经济造成巨大打击。【原文：Japan has raised the issue of auto tariffs with the US after President Donald Trump threatened to impose a 25% levy on car imports, a move that likely would deliver a big blow to Japan’s economy.】

item.title: 卡莱尔集团旗下 Hexaware 公司将在印度今年首次十亿美元 IPO 后亮相
item.description: 卡莱尔集团公司（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：Carlyle Group Inc.’s Hexaware Technologies Ltd. will begin trading in Mumbai on Wednesday after India’s first billion-dollar initial public offering of the year.】

item.title: 中国新房价格微跌显示市场趋稳
item.description: 1 月份，中国新房价格降幅连续第五个月放缓，这表明随着政策制定者加大力度结束房地产市场的低迷，房价开始趋于稳定。【原文：China’s decline in new-home prices eased for a fifth month in January, suggesting values are beginning to stabilize as policymakers step up efforts to end the property slump.】

item.title: 新西兰第三次大幅降息振兴经济
item.description: 新西兰中央银行连续第三次降息 50 个基点，以帮助重振疲弱的经济，并表示将在未来几个季度采取更多宽松措施。【原文：New Zealand’s central bank cut interest rates by 50 basis points for the third straight meeting to help revive the ailing economy and signaled more easing in coming quarters.】

item.title: 澳大利亚工资增长进一步放缓，印证澳大利亚央行降息决定
item.description: 去年最后三个月，澳大利亚的工资增长进一步放缓，反映出整个经济的价格压力有所缓解，也证明了储备银行最终放宽货币政策的决定是正确的。【原文：Australia’s wage growth slowed further in the final three months of last year, reflecting an easing in price pressures across the economy and vindicating the Reserve Bank’s decision to finally ease monetary policy.】

item.title: iPhone 零件制造商村田制作所将供应链转向印度
item.description: IPhone 元件制造商村田制作所（Murata Manufacturing Co.【原文：IPhone components maker Murata Manufacturing Co. is weighing moving some production capacity to India, reflecting a global realignment of the supply chain toward the world’s most populous country.】

item.title: 中国修改电力市场规则，挑战可再生能源的蓬勃发展
item.description: 中国可再生能源的空前繁荣正面临着来自政府规定的新挑战，这些规定将允许市场力量决定新的风能和太阳能发电的价格。【原文：China’s unprecedented boom in renewable energy is facing a fresh challenge from government rules that will allow market forces to determine the price of new wind and solar power.】

item.title: 研究院称体育债务有望成为证券化的最新抵押品
item.description: Academy Securities Inc.周二发布的一份报告称，体育赛事门票销售可能成为下一种债务证券化的抵押品，尤其是随着越来越多的投资公司抢购职业运动队的股票。【原文：Ticket sales to sporting events could become collateral for the next type of debt securitization, according to a Tuesday note from Academy Securities Inc., especially as more investment firms snap up shares of professional sports teams.】

item.title: 关税和地缘政治忧虑助推黄金需求，黄金价格接近历史纪录
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发出了新的关税威胁，加上地缘政治不确定性不断增加，避险需求升温，黄金在历史高位附近持稳。【原文：Gold was steady near a record high, with fresh tariff threats from President Donald Trump and mounting geopolitical uncertainties fanning haven demand.】

item.title: 鉴于特朗普援助关系紧张，南非预算受到更多审查
item.description: 南非财政部长面临着压力，他必须制定一条经济路线，以应对唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战所带来的危险。【原文：South Africa’s finance minister is under pressure to chart an economic course that navigates the hazards unleashed by Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 印度胃炎疫情创纪录，显示潜伏健康风险
item.description: 2024 年，急性腹泻疫情飙升至有记录以来的最高点，这是全球最常见的细菌和病毒性疾病也出现异常疫情的最新例证。【原文：Outbreaks of acute diarrheal disease surged to the highest on record in 2024, in the latest example of unusual surges of even the most common bacterial and viral ailments across the world.】

item.title: 特朗普关税措施出台前日本出口再度增长
item.description: 就在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普推出一系列预计将在未来数月生效的保护主义政策之际，由于企业增加订单，日本 1 月份的出口增速加快。【原文：Japan’s exports rose at a faster clip in January as businesses ramped up orders just as US President Donald Trump unleashed a barrage of protectionist policies expected to take effect in coming months.】

item.title: 石油涨后趋稳，欧佩克+和俄罗斯供应成焦点
item.description: 由于欧佩克+可能推迟增加供应，以及来自俄罗斯的流量存在不确定性，石油价格在上涨后趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied after advancing on the possible postponement of OPEC+ supply increases and uncertainty around flows from Russia.】

item.title: 中国投资者购买香港股票数量为四年来最多
item.description: 中国内地投资者周二买入了价值 224 亿港元（28.8 亿美元）的香港股票，继续推动受 DeepSeek 刺激的香港科技股上涨。【原文：Chinese mainland investors bought HK$22.4 billion ($2.88 billion) worth of Hong Kong stocks on Tuesday, as they continued to drive a DeepSeek-spurred tech rally in the city.】

item.title: 创纪录的盈利掩盖了日本企业不甚乐观的前景
item.description: 日本公司最近公布的盈利增长亮眼，但基本趋势并不像看上去那么强劲，这表明仅凭最新业绩不太可能推动日股走出窄幅震荡区间。【原文：Companies in Japan reported stellar earnings growth recently, but the underlying trend isn’t as robust as it seems, suggesting the latest results alone aren’t likely to push Japanese shares out of their narrow range.】

item.title: 特朗普在最新命令中加强对银行和并购监管机构的控制
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统在周二的一项行政命令中试图控制独立的联邦机构，目的是遏制华盛顿一些最有权力的监管机构监督银行和其他公司的能力。【原文：President Donald Trump sought to rein in independent federal agencies in an executive order Tuesday that aims to curb the ability of some of Washington’s most powerful regulators to oversee banks and other companies.】

item.title: 特朗普提出更多关税措施，亚洲交易员态度谨慎：市场综述
item.description: 由于更广泛的全球贸易战的威胁和地缘政治的不确定性继续给投资者带来压力，亚洲股市早盘将出现下跌。【原文：Asian stocks are poised for early losses as the threat of a broader global trade war and geopolitical uncertainty continue to weigh on investors.】

item.title: 日本顶级保险公司九个月内债券损失 30 亿美元
item.description: 根据三家日本顶级寿险公司的财报，去年 4 月至 12 月期间，它们在销售国内债券方面共出现了 4,670 亿日元（30 亿美元）的交易损失。【原文：Three of Japan’s top life insurers booked a combined ¥467 billion ($3 billion) of trading losses on sales of domestic bonds in the April-December period last year, according to their earnings statements.】

item.title: 辉瑞首席执行官称辉瑞易受欧洲关税威胁影响
item.description: 辉瑞公司首席执行官阿尔伯特-布尔拉（Albert Bourla）表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普可能会对欧盟征收关税，而辉瑞公司在欧盟设有生产工厂，因此辉瑞公司很容易受到影响。【原文：Pfizer Inc. is vulnerable to the possibility that President Donald Trump will place tariffs on the European Union, where the drugmaker has manufacturing plants, Chief Executive Officer Albert Bourla said.】

item.title: 惠普将以 1.16 亿美元收购前苹果经理人创办的 Ai Pin 初创公司 Humane 的部分股权
item.description: 惠普公司将以 1.16 亿美元的价格收购人道公司的资产，该公司是 2023 年底推出的可穿戴 Ai Pin 的制造商。【原文：HP Inc. will acquire assets from Humane Inc., the maker of a wearable Ai Pin introduced in late 2023, for $116 million.】

item.title: 赛勒为比特币再筹 20 亿美元的策略
item.description: 迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）的 "战略 "公司（Strategy）计划在一次非公开发行中发行 20 亿美元的可转换债务，从而扩展了这家自称比特币财务公司的非常规筹资战略。【原文：Michael Saylor’s Strategy plans to offer $2 billion of convertible debt in a private offering, extending the self-styled Bitcoin treasury company’s unconventional fundraising strategy.】

item.title: 特朗普称可能对汽车、药品和芯片征收 25% 的关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统表示，他可能会对汽车、半导体和药品进口征收 25% 左右的关税，最快将于 4 月 2 日宣布。【原文：President Donald Trump said he would likely impose tariffs on automobile, semiconductor and pharmaceutical imports of around 25%, with an announcement coming as soon as April 2.】

item.title: 蒙得列兹公司认为可可价格上涨导致巧克力价格最高上涨 50
item.description: 好时公司（Hershey Co.）和蒙代尔兹国际公司（Mondelez International Inc.【原文：Executives from Hershey Co. and Mondelez International Inc. signaled more price increases may be coming as the chocolate makers navigate a sustained rise in cocoa prices.】

item.title: 华尔街的中国计划在经历多年挫折和特朗普的紧张局势后摇摇欲坠。
item.description:
各大银行在重新思考发展战略的同时，也在减少投资和裁员。【原文：

Los principales bancos están reduciendo sus inversiones y recortando puestos de trabajo mientras replantean sus estrategias de crecimiento.

】

item.title: 日本反对党希望利用日本央行 ETF 支付免费教育费用
item.description: 据一位日本最大的反对党官员称，作为货币政策正常化的一部分，该党希望利用日本央行的交易所交易基金来帮助支付免费高中教育的费用。【原文：Japan’s largest opposition party wants to use the Bank of Japan’s exchange-traded funds to help cover the cost of making high school education free as part of the normalization of monetary policy, according to a party official.】

item.title: 前野村策略师称分析师无法预测日本股市
item.description: 野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.【原文：Analysts’ forecasts for Japanese stocks show little correlation with their actual performance, according to an analysis of 20 years of data from a former chief strategist at Nomura Holdings Inc. who now teaches at a university in Tokyo.】

item.title: 美国国会参议员考虑出售无线电频谱以获取 1000 亿美元收益
item.description: 参议院共和党人正在考虑大规模出售无线电频谱，以获得数十亿美元的资金，帮助支付唐纳德-特朗普总统的议程费用，并为无线宽带释放电波。【原文：Senate Republicans are considering a massive sale of radio spectrum intended to generate billions of dollars to help pay for President Donald Trump’s agenda and free up airwaves for wireless broadband.】

item.title: 在埃利奥特的推动下，英国石油公司考虑出售嘉实多润滑油部门
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）已持有英国石油公司近5%的股份，该公司正在考虑出售其润滑油业务的可能性。【原文：BP Plc, in which activist investor Elliott Investment Management has built up a nearly 5% stake, is considering a potential sale of its lubricants business, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 能源转移公司泄漏事件凸显美国最严重的燃料泄漏记录
item.description: 根据彭博社汇编的数据，Energy Transfer LP 旗下的 Sunoco Pipeline LP 公司是宾夕法尼亚州一家输油管道的运营商，监管机构称该输油管道泄漏航空燃油的时间超过 16 个月。【原文：Energy Transfer LP’s Sunoco Pipeline LP unit, the operator of a Pennsylvania pipeline that regulators say leaked jet fuel for more than 16 months, spilled more refined fuels than any other operator in 2024, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.】
